intro: Sylitra angolensis, commonly known as the Angola sylitra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Sylitra angolensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
